lead: This week in tech highlights significant advancements in AI, startup funding, and innovative products, alongside challenges faced by major platforms like TikTok.

stories.title: Inside Google's plan to turn Gmail into a relationship-aware AI agent
stories.summary: Google is enhancing Gmail with AI capabilities that aim to make the email experience more relationship-focused. The initiative involves integrating AI to better understand user interactions and preferences, positioning Gmail as a proactive assistant in managing communications. This development reflects a broader trend of integrating AI into everyday tools to improve user engagement.

stories.title: Qualcomm backs SpotDraft to scale on-device contract AI with valuation doubling toward $400M
stories.summary: SpotDraft, an AI-driven contract management startup, has received support from Qualcomm, leading to a significant increase in its valuation. The company processes over a million contracts annually, demonstrating robust growth in the legal tech space. This investment highlights the increasing interest in AI solutions that streamline business processes.

stories.title: AI chip startup Ricursive hits $4B valuation two months after launch
stories.summary: Ricursive, an AI chip startup, has achieved a remarkable $4 billion valuation just two months post-launch, joining a wave of AI-focused companies receiving substantial funding. This rapid growth underscores the high demand for AI hardware solutions as industries increasingly adopt AI technologies. The startup's success reflects the vibrant investment landscape in the AI sector.

stories.title: South Koreaâ€™s Edenlux set for U.S. debut of eye-strain wellness device
stories.summary: Edenlux is preparing to launch a new wellness device in the U.S. that aims to alleviate eye strain, a growing concern in our screen-dominated lives. The device is inspired by the founder's personal experiences and leverages wearable technology to promote eye health. This launch exemplifies how startups are innovating in health tech to address modern challenges.

stories.title: People are uninstalling TikTok and downloading an indie competitor
stories.summary: As TikTok faces significant technical issues following its ownership change, users are increasingly turning to a new indie app called UpScrolled. This shift highlights the vulnerabilities of established platforms amidst operational challenges. UpScrolled, created by an Australian developer, is seeing a surge in downloads, indicating a potential shift in user preferences.

stories.title: Google's Gemini AI Will Now Generate Meeting Suggestions in Your Calendar
stories.summary: Google's Gemini AI is set to enhance Google Calendar by generating meeting suggestions based on user availability and existing commitments. This feature aims to streamline scheduling and improve productivity for users. The integration of AI into calendar management reflects a growing trend towards smarter, more intuitive digital tools.

stories.title: Meta to test premium subscriptions on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
stories.summary: Meta is exploring premium subscription models across its platforms, including Instagram and WhatsApp, offering users enhanced features while keeping basic services free. This move could reshape the monetization strategies of social media platforms, as they seek new revenue streams amidst increasing competition and regulatory scrutiny.

stories.title: OpenAI spills technical details about how its AI coding agent works
stories.summary: OpenAI has released detailed insights into the workings of its AI coding agent, Codex, providing transparency into its operations. This information is significant for developers and researchers interested in understanding AI capabilities and limitations. The disclosure aligns with ongoing discussions about the ethical implications of AI in coding and software development.

stories.title: TikTok reports 'major infrastructure issue' causing app glitches, bugs
stories.summary: TikTok is grappling with a major infrastructure issue that has led to widespread app glitches and user frustrations. The problems arose shortly after a change in ownership, raising concerns about the platform's stability. This situation underscores the challenges faced by tech companies during transitions and the impact on user experience.
